Image 39 of 39 Danny Trejo visits South San Antonio High School, Mi Tierra, Jesse Borrergo during Alamo City trip 1 / 39 Back to Gallery Sleepy eyes of students at South San Antonio High School were widened Tuesday morning when they filed into the campus’ gym to find none other than the Machete, Danny Trejo, standing center court.
The Southside high school wasn’t the setting for another action-packed film, but Trejo captivated his audience of teenagers with life stories and motivational speech.
Janice Hernandez, spokeswoman for the South San Independent School District, told mySA.com the event was something the high school’s principal spontaneously coordinated with the actor.
RELATED: In Danny Trejo's newest movie role, he will lead a Mexican drug cartel of robots
Hollywood’s tough guy smiled in front of bleachers filled with students as he talked about the importance of education and hard work.
“(The students) were excited because it’s one thing to hear about someone’s story, but having the chance to see him in person was really motivational,” Hernandez said.
RELATED: Actor Danny Trejo will open a taco restaurant soon
Annette Orta, a parent of a South San student, posted a Facebook photo of Trejo changing into a school T-shirt to become an honorary Bobcat.
Trejo shared photos on Facebook and Twitter of his trip to the Alamo City and thanked the high school for hosting him.
“Thank you South San Antonio High School for having me! It was great meeting all of you future leaders,” he said.
RELATED: Serena Williams takes Texas: floats San Marcos River, watches Drake at Austin City Limits
The Machete star spent the rest of his day at Mi Tierra and catching up with San Antonio’s own, Jesse Borego, who shared the screen with Trejo in “Blood In Blood Out.”
The macho actor has been working on several projects recently including a commercial , films and a new Los Angeles taco restaurant .
mmendoza@mysa.com
